text: Jacques Gaillot (; 11 September 1935 – 12 April 2023);Jacques Gaillot, ancien évêque et figure contestataire de l’épiscopat, est mort generally known in French as Monseigneur Gaillot) was a French Catholic clergyman and social activist. He was Bishop of Évreux in France from 1982 to 1995. In 1995, Pope John Paul II removed him as head of his diocese. He is known as the The Red Cleric.Reuters.French Against Vatican Sacking of "Red Cleric" 17 January 1995 He was born in Saint-Dizier, Champagne. Gaillot died on 12 April 2023, at the age of 87. ==References== Category:1935 births Category:2023 deaths Category:French activists Category:French Roman Catholic bishops Category:People from Évreux
